description.narrative: Community structures in selected districts are equipped with knowledge and skills to promote equitable use of HIV services and referral to child protection and social protection services, by children, adolescents and pregnant/lactating women by 2018, which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 90% of children, adolescents and pregnant and lactating women utilize equitable, gender-sensitive HIV prevention, care and treatment services by 2018

sector.narrative: HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
PMTCT program support such as retention in care, family planning, infant feeding, infant medical male circumcision and community facility linkages

title.narrative: Malawi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Malawi 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community structures in selected districts are equipped with knowledge and skills to promote equitable use of HIV services and referral to child protection and social protection services, by children, adolescents and pregnant/lactating women by 2018

description.narrative: Community engagement and differentiated models of service delivery are in place and strengthened to increase access to, and retention in, HIV and sexual and reproductive health services. Bi-directional linkages with nutrition and child protection services increased the comprehensive delivery of services to children. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Children with severe acute malnutrition referred for an HIV test
Adolescents 15-19 who were tested for HIV and received their results in the past 12 months
Proportion of children admitted in Community Management of Acute Malnutrition with known HIV status
